alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:45PM EST until January 13 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Rawlings affecting Brunswick and Dinwiddie Counties. Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EST Wednesday was 19.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.3 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning to 5.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 5.9 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.6 feet on 03/04/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 745 AM EST.
